RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 7F Dirt CR: 68. Maiden Claiming Purse 16600. FOR MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BON BUENO tapered in and stalked the early pace from the three path, took the lead passing the half mile pole, was given rein to draw clear toward the quarter, widened at the rail through the far turn and finished on her own initiative. BARRELHOUSE saved ground close to the early pace, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail and got up for second mid-stretch. RUSH TO CANDY settled off the rail on the first turn then eased out entering the backstretch, gave chase toward the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn in the four path and came along to take third the final strides. NORLANDER tapered to the inside and rated the early pace, was met passing the half mile pole and gave chase from that point, but dropped back at the rail toward the quarter pole and weakened leaving the far turn. SHADES OF BLUE saved ground. MR MAJESTIC rounded the opening turn about the three path and showed little response through the backstretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Barrelhouse
ENTRY.OWNER: Warren Andrew N and Warren Rania

ENTRY.NAME: Rush to Candy
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,eased out 1/2,chased 7/16,4p far turn,along 3rd late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 73. Allowance Purse 27400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, OR WAIVER CLAIMING OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 9 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since July 9 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LUCKY BOP stalked from the three path the first turn, started a four wide bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole and raced at a close disadvantage in the three path on the far turn, dug in leaving the turn and got up the final yards. LA MADDALENA stalked off the rail, challenged leaving the seven sixteenths pole and took the nod toward the five sixteenths pole, dug in under steady encouragement leaving the far turn but was caught in the final yards. POLISH THE DIAMOND set the early pace inside, came under pressure leaving the seven sixteenths pole and was met toward the five sixteenths, gave chase at that point but dropped back approaching the quarter then flattened stride the final sixteenth. FRENCHIES GOLD settled off the rail on the first turn, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and ran evenly in the lane. CASTLE OF CAYLEE saved ground well off the pace, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole, raced in the six path on the far turn and passed some rivals widest. SPARKLEINYOUREYE rounded the first turn about the four path, picked up the chase leaving the three eighths pole and raced in the five path on the far turn, then flattened in the lane. MAY MAYS CASTLE rated close inside on the first turn, eased out leaving the turn and gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the three path and weakened into the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: May Mays Castle
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close inside,eased out 1/2,chased 7/16,3p far turn,weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Lucky Bop
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 3p,4wd bid 7/16,close 3p far turn,up final yards

ENTRY.NAME: Castle of Caylee
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,chased 3/8,6p far turn,passed rivals outside

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 7F Dirt CR: 45. Maiden Claiming Purse 13000. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $7,500, if for $7,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JOOBY DOOBY DOO took a quick lead and moved to the inside to show the way, came under pressure approaching the five sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and was kept sharp in the stretch. ASTRAYAL stalked three wide, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole and raced at the rail on the far turn, then dueled through the stretch for second. JUBA'S MOCHA rounded the opening turn in the five path, picked up the chase leaving the three eighths pole, raced two deep on the far turn and was outfinished in the stretch duel for second. I SEE NOTHING rated close inside, picked up the chase leaving the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail then eased outward into the lane, but showed little further. REAL RICK was forced outward entering the first turn then angled back to the inside, gave chase from the half mile pole but showed little response. ALL ROADS TO DENIS settled in the three path the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch. WORM stalked the early pace two deep, faded on the first turn and was not encouraged further the final quarter mile.

ENTRY.NAME: I See Nothing
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close,chased 3/8,rail far turn,eased out 1/8,empty lane

ENTRY.NAME: Jooby Dooby Doo
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured 5/16,rail far turn,kept sharp lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 7F Dirt CR: 84. Allowance Purse 28400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 9 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since July 9 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Whe re Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JUBA'S PARADE was reluctant to load then tapered in and stalked from the three path the first turn, challenged leaving the half mile pole and contested even terms from the three eighths, took the nod approaching the quarter pole and was steadily handled in the lane. FOXY SISTA rated off the rail on the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced close three wide on the far turn and cleared second mid-stretch. MARINA GRANDE rated the pace inside, came under pressure leaving the half mile pole and was met at even terms from the three eighths, ceded the nod approaching the quarter then flattened in the lane. NO DENYING DENIS saved ground on the turns. EX RATED saved ground. STRONG WILLED rounded the first turn in the three and four paths, showed little response through the backstretch and was eased the final quarter mile.

ENTRY.NAME: Marina Grande
ENTRY.OWNER: Jay A Reese LLC and Hatter Edgar

ENTRY.NAME: Strong Willed
ENTRY.OWNER: Nikki Horses Racing and Fanelli John

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 91. Starter Allowance Purse 18600. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $5,000 OR LESS SINCE SEPTEMBER 9, 2021. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 9 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since July 9 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Wher e Entered For $8,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ADVANCE CASH gave chase and took the lead two deep midway on the turn, bore out approaching the head of the lane but dueled clear toward mid-stretch and drew off the final sixteenth. COWBOY AT HEART chased toward the inside, rounded the turn near the rail then dug in through the stretch and got up for second under the wire. KITCHEN FIRE veered out on the chute then contested the pace and took over at the seven sixteenths pole, drew briefly clear toward the five sixteenths, but was met midway on the turn, flattened inside the eighth pole then nipped from second under the wire. BIG DADDY D R chased through the backstretch, raced in the five path on the turn and passed some rivals outside. PIT STOP MAN gave chase outside, rounded the turn about the four path then flattened stride. CHARITABLY GIFTED chased inside, raced in the three path on the turn and showed little in the lane. MR TINGLES was shuffled back on the chute but contested the early pace, dropped back toward the five sixteenths pole and faded at the rail on the turn. GRUMPELSTILTSKIN became very fractious in the gate then trailed while saving ground.

ENTRY.NAME: Charitably Gifted
ENTRY.OWNER: Shepherd Robert Phillips Jason and Harrison Glenn N

ENTRY.NAME: Cowboy At Heart
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside,rail turn,dug in lane,up 2nd wire

ENTRY.NAME: Kitchen Fire
ENTRY.COMMENT: veered out chute,contested pace,briefly clear,met turn,nipped 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Mr Tingles
ENTRY.COMMENT: shuffled back chute,contested early pace,faded rail turn

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 73. Claiming Purse 12300. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Three Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MASTER THIS stalked from the four path the first turn, started a three wide bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole and took the lead a furlong later, drew clear approaching the quarter and promptly drew off through the far turn, was kept alert to mid-stretch then taken in hand later yards. TRANSFER THE FUNDS raced in the four path the first turn then saved ground on the second turn, bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole, circled rivals in the six path on the far turn and dueled for second past the eighth pole. ADARA stalked from the three path on the first turn then saved ground into the second turn, picked up the chase past the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the four path on the far turn and flattened in the lane. VOLIERO saved ground off the pace, gave chase passing the half mile pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and showed little further. RIGHTEOUS MAN saved ground on the first turn, showed little response through the backstretch and rounded the far turn about the six path. SCOOTSCOOT rated the pace inside, came under pressure leaving the seven sixteenths pole, was met toward the five sixteenths, raced off the rail on the far turn and weakened. SULEMAN rated close off the rail, challenged leaving the seven sixteenths pole but dropped back at the five sixteenths and faded into the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Voliero
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,chased 1/2,rail far turn,little in lane

ENTRY.NAME: Transfer the Funds
ENTRY.OWNER: Gardner Sean and MIH Affiliates LLC

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 7F Dirt CR: 89. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 28300. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING OR STARTER SINCE MARCH 8, 2023 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $20,000. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non -winners Of A Race Since August 9 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since July 9 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $20,000 (Races Where Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: REMYS SHOWTIME veered out leaving the gate then took over approaching the three quarter pole and moved to the inside to rate the pace, came under pressure leaving the seven sixteenths, was met at the quarter and contested even terms nearest the rail on the far turn, dug in determinedly while drifting outward through the stretch and just lasted. BUFF'S EYE VIEW settled in the three path on the first turn, started a bid leaving the three eighths pole and steadily progressed, raced in the three path on the far turn, moved to the rail leaving the turn, dug in and just missed. OUT OF CENTS raced in the five path the opening turn, started a bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole and contested even terms into the far turn, but flattened stride toward mid-stretch. FANCY CONCHO raced off the pace inside on the first turn, gave chase approaching the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn in the five path then flattened in the lane. BUBBA GRUMP settled off the rail on the first turn then entered the backstretch about the four path, bid toward the three eighths pole, raced in the three path on the far turn, drifted into the lane and weakened. RIVER CROSROAD RVF was forced outward leaving the gate then stalked from the two and three paths on the first turn, challenged passing the seven sixteenths pole but weakened into the far turn. COMMAND THE CAT was forced outward leaving the gate then stalked from the four path the first turn, challenged leaving the seven sixteenths pole but faded past the five sixteenths.

ENTRY.NAME: Fancy Concho
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace inside,chased 3/8,5p far turn,flattened lane

ENTRY.NAME: Buff's Eye View
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3p 1st turn,bid 3/8,3p far turn,dug in rail lane,just missed

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Timothy C. Grams & Judith A. Grams

ENTRY.NAME: Out of Cents
ENTRY.OWNER: Coleswood Farm Inc and G L M Stables

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 58. Claiming Purse 7800. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE SEPTEMBER 9, 2022. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 9, 2022 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000 (W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: STYLISH PAINT stalked two deep then challenged leaving the seven sixteenths pole, took the nod approaching the quarter, raced clear midway on the far turn and was steadily handled to hold on well. MARKETABILITY rounded the first turn in the three path, picked up the chase leaving the three eighths pole and raced in the three path on the far turn, drifted leaving the turn and ran evenly in the lane. WOODSONG'S CASTLE raced in the four path the first turn, left the turn outside and gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, came through the far turn about the five path and was along for third the final yards. BROADWAY PEGGY took a quick lead and rated the pace inside, came under pressure leaving the seven sixteenths pole, was met at the rail approaching the quarter, dropped back midway on the far turn and weakened in the stretch. UPSY DAISY DO raced in the three path on the opening turn and showed little response through the backstretch. RISKSRHIGHPAYISLOW rounded the first turn in the three path, gave chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole but flattened stride into the far turn. SO RED THE ROSE saved ground on the first turn and was through early.

ENTRY.NAME: Stylish Paint
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W
